verse:
If ye fear that ye shall not be able to deal justly with the orphans, Marry women of your choice, Two or three or four; but if ye fear that ye shall not be able to deal justly (with them), then only one, or 
            (a captive) that your right hands possess, that will be more suitable, to prevent you from doing injustice.
To those weak of understanding Make not over your property, which Allah hath made a means of support for you, but feed and clothe them therewith, and speak to them words of kindness and justice.
But those who disobey Allah and His Messenger and transgress His limits will be admitted to a Fire, to abide therein: And they shall have a humiliating punishment.

That they said (in boast), 'We killed Christ Jesus the son of Mary, the Messenger of Allah';- but they killed him not, nor crucified him, but so it was made to appear to them, and those who differ therein are full 
            of doubts, with no (certain) knowledge, but only conjecture to follow, for of a surety they killed him not:-
It was We that made the hills declare, in unison with him, Our Praises, at eventide and at break of day,
This is no less than a Message to (all) the Worlds.
Whatever ye are given (here) is (but) a convenience of this life: but that which is with Allah is better and more lasting: (it is) for those who believe and put their trust in their Lord:
Cast down will be (their owners') eyes.
And before Solomon were marshalled his hosts,- of Jinns and men and birds, and they were all kept in order and ranks.
When the earth is shaken to her (utmost) convulsion,
Will be in a life of good pleasure and satisfaction.
(It is) a Fire Blazing fiercely!
Except such as have Faith, and do righteous deeds, and (join together) in the mutual teaching of Truth, and of Patience and Constancy.
It shall be made into a vault over them,
Seest thou one who denies the Judgment (to come)?
Say: He is Allah, the One and Only;
I worship not that which ye worship,
When comes the Help of Allah, and Victory,
Will have his home in a (bottomless) Pit.
A votary when he (turns) to pray?
